intro: Philibertia coalita, commonly known as the narrowleaf filaree, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has slender, hairy stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually pale blue or white, with ray florets that give it a daisy-like appearance.
